At least 80% of students show warning signs before attempting suicide—but far too few teachers, staff, & students know what to look for.

It would restore the SCOTUS to their powers as delineated in Article III of the Constitution, shift Appellate jurisdiction to a randomly selected group of senior appellate judges less vulnerable to political influence and eliminate the shadow docket.  Among other things...

Congress has the power to hold this Court to account.  And it is time we exercise that power.  That's why I introduced the Restoring Judicial Separation of Powers Act.  https://casten.house.gov/imo/media/doc/one-pager_restoring-judicial-separation-of-powers-act.pdf

But this court has grown "high on it's own supply" as they say.  They lack the humility demanded of a coequal branch, have decided they have no accountability and are using the Court not to deliver a greater good but to make their selfish views into law.

I put "textualism" in quotes because it's a BS theory, like "originalism".  Justices are no smarter or less free from partially formed opinion, prejudices and experiences than anyone else with a finite set of life experiences.  Their rulings are called "opinions" for a reason.

Our environmental regulators recognized this in the expansion of WOTUS laws.  But 5 members of the Supreme Court think they have the right to overturn because why?  So that Harlan Crow and whoever else paid them to get on the court piss in your pond without recourse?

The idea that your neighbor could pollute his water in a vernal pool that flows into your water in the spring but not be accountable because it dries up in the fall isn't science.  It isn't law.  It's Mad Max, nihilistic free-for-all anarchy.

Writ large, no one outside of a 3rd grade geography lesson thinks global hydrology is just rivers that flow continuously, always at the same level, ponds, lakes and oceans.  Entire ecosystems exist in vernal pools that seasonally flood and drain.

The idea that clean water laws apply only to water in a "continuously flowing water body" is logic that puts "textualism" above physical reality.  All of us know that spot in our neighborhood that is wet in the spring and dry in the summer.

This is a remarkably bad decision for physical reasons.  And is one of too many lately where SCOTUS sees itself as not only superior to two other co-equal branches, but superior to the laws of physics. https://www.nytimes.com/2023/05/25/us/supreme-court-epa-water-pollution.html?campaign_id=9&emc=edit_nn_20230526&instance_id=93532&nl=the-morning&regi_id=122734672&segment_id=133967&te=1&user_id=17978ecbe44c54cae59016cc6d44ec19
